column1: Ejido (Venezuelan Spanish pronunciation: [eˈhiðo]) is a town in the state of Mérida
column2: Venezuela. It is the shire town of the Campo Elías Municipality. It was founded in 1650 in an area with indigenous Guayabas
column3: and became a center for cane sugar cultivation. It is close to the state capital
column6: and forms part of its metropolitan area
column7: with a total population of around 350
column8: 000. It is connected to Mérida by public transport
